Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of charioteer (head lost) standing to right in stationary chariot, wearing long white chiton with trace of added red on belt, holding reins and goad; at far side of chariot, part of archer, to right with quiver.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.42)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 281, no. B244)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0157) (Phase 1)
